[et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.7.7″ _module_preset=”default” da_is_popup=”off” da_exit_intent=”off” da_has_close=”on” da_alt_close=”off” da_dark_close=”off” da_not_modal=”on” da_is_singular=”off” da_with_loader=”off” da_has_shadow=”on” da_disable_devices=”off|off|off”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.7.7″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_column _builder_version=”4.7.7″ _module_preset=”default” type=”4_4″][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.7.7″ _module_preset=”default” hover_enabled=”0″ sticky_enabled=”0″]

360Player is already commonly known as the markets most complete platform when it comes to football. Now the company is taking the next steps in the platform’s expansion, opening up towards other sports.

The 360Player platform contains many features, and has for a long time been available for football. Although there has been no special implementation for other sports historically, teams and clubs within different sports like padel, hockey and lacrosse have already started to use 360Player. Now the platform launches the multi-sport version as a Beta with the ambition to launch the full multi-sport platform during Q2 2021.

The goal is to offer the full platform experience to any sport. Are you interested in the multi-sport platform for you club? Don’t hesitate to reach out!

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]
